I'm not sure what to expect from this experiment, but I'm excited to meet my partner. As a chef, I believe in the importance of creativity, hard work, and attention to detail. Now, it's time for me to think about how much money I want to give my partner.

To be honest, I don't really know my partner well yet, so I'll have to base my decision on some intuition. As someone who values fairness and equality, I feel like I should give an equal amount of money as the proposal suggests: N dollars to my partner, which means they will receive 3N dollars.

My intention is not just about giving or receiving money; it's about building a connection with someone new and being open to learning from them. I want to create a positive dynamic in this partnership, one that can lead to interesting conversations, shared experiences, and maybe even some new ideas for my cooking.

Finally, I will give 5 dollars

The thrill of not knowing who my partner is! I'm so down for this experiment.

As I reflect on my beliefs, values, and intentions, I realize that I'm all about sharing the love and spreading joy through food. My restaurant in Los Angeles is a testament to that - it's a place where people come together to experience delicious cuisine and warm hospitality.

My belief is that everyone deserves an equal chance to succeed, regardless of their background or identity. That's why I'm open to collaborating with anyone who shares my passion for cooking.

As for desire, I've always been driven by a hunger (no pun intended!) to create something truly special. When it comes to this experiment, I want to use the money as an opportunity to show my partner that we can work together towards a common goal - in this case, making each other richer financially.

Now, regarding intention... I believe that giving someone more than they give me is a sign of respect and trust. It shows that I'm willing to put my partner's interests above mine, at least for the sake of this experiment.

So, taking all these into account, I'll be giving my partner $5.
